Class Record

  • java.lang.Object
    • Record
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Record>

    public class Record
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Record>
    The Record class represents a general n-fields wide database record

    The Record implemets Comparable All fields of the record are of type String A Record contains mutators and accessors to all fields,method to get number of fields of a Record,it overrides toString(),compareTo() and equals()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Record(int numberOfFields)
      Initializes a newly created Record with number of fields specified by the parameter All fields are set to "none" by default
      Record(java.lang.String... fields)
      Initializes a newly created Record with field given If field is wished to be skipped it must be set to "none"
      Record(java.lang.String record)
      Initializes a newly created Record with field given in a record If field is wished to be skipped it must be set to "none"

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Record otherRecord)
        Compares two Records
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Record>
        Parameters:
        otherRecord - A Record to be compared with
        Returns:
        -1 if this.numberOfFields < otherRecord.numberOfFields or and 1 otherwise -1 if the first non-equal field is less then otherRecord's,1 otherwise and 0 if all the fields are equal -2 if either of the Records is default(that is all fields are "none")
